1.brief: properly, like this, i.e. by implication, (of manner) thus (or so); also (of place) here (or hither); or (of time) now
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
properly, covered, i.e. a throne (as canopied)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda
the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)
repose or (adverbially) peacefully; figuratively, consolation (specifically, matrimony); hence (concretely) an abode

2.brief: properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
these or those
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)

these or those
an oracle

near, with or among; often in general, to

to scan, i.e. look intently at; by implication, to regard with pleasure, favor or care
near, with or among; often in general, to
depressed, in mind or circumstances
smitten, i.e. (literally) maimed, or (figuratively) dejected

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
fearful; also reverential
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause

3.brief: to slaughter (in sacrifice or massacre)
a bullock (as a traveller)
to strike (lightly or severely, literally or figuratively)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
to slaughter an animal (usually in sacrifice)
a member of a flock, i.e. a sheep or goat
to break the neck; hence (figuratively) to destroy
a dog; hence (by euphemism) a male prostitute
to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
a donation; euphemistically, tribute; specifically a sacrificial offering (usually bloodless and voluntary)
blood (as that which when shed causes death) of man or an animal; by analogy, the juice of the grape; figuratively (especially in the plural) bloodshed (i.e. drops of blood)
a hog (perhaps as penned)
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
frankincense (from its whiteness or perhaps that of its smoke)
to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
they (only used when emphatic)
properly, to try, i.e. (by implication) select
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
disgusting, i.e. filthy; especially idolatrous or (concretely) an idol
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
properly, to incline to; by implication (literally but rarely) to bend; figuratively, to be pleased with, desire
